item.title: Bet add a quote by Viggo Mortensen
item.description: "Can you join, ask sincerely for affection without sweaty hand of expectation, understanding and accepting if it never is given?" -- Viggo Mortensen

item.title: Bet add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Bet add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "You begin saving the world by saving one man at a time; all else is grandiose romanticism or politics." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Bet add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "If you're lonely when you're alone, you're in bad company." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Bet add a quote by Robert Bresson
item.description: "The most ordinary word, when put into place, suddenly acquires brilliance. That is the brilliance with which your images must shine." -- Robert Bresson

item.title: Bet add a quote by Robert Bresson
item.description: "Make visible what, without you, might perhaps never have been seen." -- Robert Bresson

item.title: Bet add a quote by Sara Nelson
item.description: "When things go right, I read. When things go wrong, I read more." -- Sara Nelson

item.title: Bet add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Draw a crazy picture, Write a nutty poem, Sing a mumble-gumble song, Whistle through your comb. Do a loony-goony dance 'Cross the kitchen floor, Put something silly in the world That ain't been there before." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Bet add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "If you are a dreamer come in If you are a dreamer a wisher a liar A hoper a pray-er a magic-bean-buyer If youre a pretender com sit by my fire For we have some flax golden tales to spin Come in! Come in!" -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Bet add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Bet add a quote by Louis de Bernieres
item.description: "Love is a temporary madness, it erupts like volcanoes and then subsides. And when it subsides, you have to make a decision. You have to work out whether your roots have so entwined together that it is inconceivable that you should ever part. Because this is what love is. Love is not breathlessness, it is not excitement, it is not the promulgation of promises of eternal passion, it is not the desire to mate every second minute of the day, it is not lying awake at night imagining that he is kissing every cranny of your body. No, don't blush, I am telling you some truths. That is just being "in love", which any fool can do. Love itself is what is left over when being in love has burned away, and this is both an art and a fortunate accident." -- Louis de Bernieres

item.title: Bet add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "There is a crack in everything. That's how the light gets in." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Bet add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "As our eyes grow accustomed to sight they armour themselves against wonder. " -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Bet add a quote by Манук Жажоян
item.description: "Ласкать книгу - то же, что ласкать себя. Это странное, часто пугающее ощущение, но оно никогда не приведёт к тоске и унынию, ибо здесь нет отчуждения. Здесь нет я и другой, но только лишь я и ты, я и ты в моих руках, безмолвная, безответная, но всегда говорящая - не слуху, не уму и даже не сердцу, но глазам. Глазам и пальцам. Пальцам и губам, которые припадают к страницам ... не реже, чем к щеке. В этом, наконец, и заключается тайна поэзии." -- Манук Жажоян
